title.text: The binary trio at SemEval-2019 Task 5: Multitarget Hate Speech Detection in Tweets

entities.text: Multitarget Hate Speech Detection in Tweets

abstractContent.text: The massive growth of user-generated web content through blogs, online forums and most notably, social media networks, led to a large spreading of hatred or abusive messages which have to be moderated.
This paper proposes a supervised approach to hate speech detection towards immigrants and women in En-glish tweets.
Several models have been developed ranging from feature-engineering approaches to neural ones.
We also carried out a detailed error analysis to show main causes of misclassification.

tableCaptions.text: Table 1: Tweet distribution in the corpora
Table 2: Hate speech detection results. Best results are presented in bold font while * marks the system  submitted for the official ranking.
